intro: Angraecum ashantense, commonly known as the Ashanti orchid, is a rare and striking epiphytic orchid native to the rainforests of western Africa. It is characterized by its long, pendulous inflorescences bearing numerous fragrant, white to pale blue flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, loose substrates for optimal growth. Its flowers are particularly notable for their intricate structure and nocturnal pollination mechanism, attracting specific moths. Angraecum ashantense is a popular species among orchid enthusiasts due to its beauty and rarity in cultivation.
